> ðŸ“˜ This configuration is currently ineffective

* By default, the optimized delivery route generated by the system will try to allocate the products as much as possible on each vehicle based on the capacity of the vehicle. However, this can create unbalance tasks for the drivers of a company. Therefore, the **Time Balancing** config can be used to create a balanced delivery time between drivers of a transportation group.
* To use this feature, you need to enable the following configuration at the Branch: **Time Balancing**. Then you can proceed to create orders and optimize routes as usual

![748](https://files.readme.io/01037d4-Config.png "Config.png")

* Below are the examples of the route optimization with the **Time Balancing** config

## Time Balancing Off

* When the **Time Balancing** config is not turned on, the route optimization will run by default and take the capacity of the vehicle and the orders of each vehicle into consideration meaning that the optimization will try to fulfil the capacity of the vehicle to its fullest with the products from the order

![1920](https://files.readme.io/3873904-OFF.png "OFF.png")

## Time Balancing On

* When the **Time Balancing** config is turned on, the route optimization will try to create a balanced delivery time for the driver group meaning that the delivery time will be the priority and the system will attempt to allocate the orders to make the delivery time between drivers balanced. The example below show the optimization result of the delivery group with delivery time close to each other

![1920](https://files.readme.io/a783650-ON.png "ON.png")
